page_analysis.text_content:
Porches
&
entry
features

Facades with defined
entryways make a
streetscape pleasant
and friendly as long as
they are not out of scale
or proportion.

The gross floor area
regulations encourage
appropriately sized
porches and entryways.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.04.030(a)(113.1)
18.04.030(143.5)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

Porch types

For purposes of assessing gross floor area, porches, entryways, and balconies fall into one of these categories:

1. Non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies etc.
   • Non-roofed features generally do not count

2. Roofed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 4 A & D on p. 7, Fig 5 on p. 8)
   • Openess of the sides determines whether or not these count
     regardless of the height.
   • If they do count, they count only once.

3. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor
   that are less than 12' high (from grade) (Fig 4 B on p. 7)
   • These count once regardless of the design including openess.

4. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12'
   high from grade-"vaulted entry feature" (Fig 4 C & D on p. 7,
   Fig 6, 7, & 8 on pp. 11-13)
   • These count twice regardless of the design including openess.

5. Recessed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 9 on p. 14)
   • Height, depth, & openess determine whether or not these count.
   • If they count and are less than 17' high, they count only once.
   • If they count and are more than 17' high, they count twice.

6. Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors (Fig 10 on p. 15)
   • These count once regardless of the design including openess

Difference
between a porch
& an entry
feature:

A feature is considered
to be a porch rather than
an entry feature if it can
clearly accomodate more
activities than entering and
leaving the house.

The following pages address the details of assessing these features with regard to gross floor area.

6

visual_elements.description: A grey rectangular text block on the left side of the page containing introductory text about porches and entry features, and a list of code sections.
visual_elements.location: Left side, spanning top to bottom

visual_elements.description: A grey rectangular text block on the right side of the page providing a definition for the 'Difference between a porch & an entry feature'.

sections: Difference between a porch & an entry feature:
3. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor
4. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12' high from grade-"vaulted entry feature"
6. Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors

qualifiers.text: For purposes of assessing gross floor area
regardless of the design including openess
A feature is considered to be a porch rather than an entry feature if it can clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house.

conditions.text: Non-roofed features generally do not count
Openess of the sides determines whether or not these count
If they do count, they count only once.
Height, depth, & openess determine whether or not these count.
If they count and are less than 17' high, they count only once.
If they count and are more than 17' high, they count twice.

logical_relationships.expression: IF (Openess of the sides determines that they count) THEN (c3)
IF (Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12' high (from grade)) THEN (c5 AND q3)
IF (Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12' high from grade) THEN (c7 AND q3)
IF (Height, depth, & openess determine that these count) THEN (c9 OR c10)
c9 AND c10 are mutually exclusive conditions based on height
logical_relationships.ambiguity_note: The phrasing 'If they count and are less than 17' high' and 'If they count and are more than 17' high' implies a logical OR for the counting outcome, but the conditions themselves are distinct based on height.

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if feature is Non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies etc.
Evaluate if feature is Roofed porches on the 1st floor
Evaluate if feature is Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12' high (from grade)
Evaluate if feature is Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12' high from grade-"vaulted entry feature"
Evaluate if feature is Recessed porches on the 1st floor
Evaluate if feature is Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors
